# The attempt to place a stone furnace failed because I did not have a stone furnace in my inventory. 
# This indicates that I need to craft a stone furnace before I can smelt the iron ore.

# To craft a stone furnace, I need 5 units of stone. 
# I will first check my inventory for stone and gather it if necessary.

current_stone = inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Stone, 0)

if current_stone < 5:
    # Locate a nearby stone resource patch and gather stone.
    stone_resource_position = nearest(Resource.Stone)
    move_to(stone_resource_position)
    harvest_resource(stone_resource_position, quantity=10)  # Gather enough stone to craft the furnace.
    print(f"Harvested stone. Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")

# Now that I have stone, I can craft a stone furnace.
if inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Stone, 0) >= 5:
    craft_item(Prototype.StoneFurnace, quantity=1)
    print(f"Crafted a stone furnace. Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")
else:
    print("Not enough stone to craft a stone furnace.")  # This should not happen based on previous checks.

# After crafting the stone furnace, I will then proceed to place it and smelt the iron ore into iron plates. 
# Once I have the iron plates, I can craft the gear wheels and then the inserter.
